page.title: 13The River Dee.
page.content: The main river in Dentdale is the River Dee which runs into the River Lune a famous salmon river.Dentdale's River Dee is about 15 miles long, and about 20 foot at its widest point,it is very deep in places especially after a storm,the current can be very strong, people have been swept away and killed because of it.Many waterfalls and caves are to be found along this river,at one point it falls into a deep pool and a cave called Ibbeth Peril,this is so called because it is presumed a witch called Elizabeth lived there;she is now buried under the church gates. It is possible to canoe down the river even negotiating the weir at Rash Mill.People swim in the river and fish for trout,eels and salmon.In the summer of 1984 the river almost dried up,there was still water in the caves.
